name: Job
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job
description:
Job

A resource representing the long-running, asynchronous processing of an instance create or update operation. The job can be refreshed to retrieve the instance object once the operation has been completed.

See Project#create_instance and Instance#update.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.done? #=> false
job.reload! # API call
job.done? #=> true

if job.error?
  status = job.error
else
  instance = job.instance
end

methods.name: instance
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job#instance
methods.description: The instance that is the object of the operation.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.done? #=> false
job.reload!
job.done? #=> true
instance = job.instance

returns.description: The Instance instance, or nil if the operation is not complete.

methods.name: done?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job#done?
methods.description: Checks if the processing of the instance operation is complete.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.done? #=> false

methods.name: error?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job#error?
methods.description: Checks if the processing of the instance operation has errored.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.error? #=> false

methods.name: error
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job#error
methods.description: The status if the operation associated with this job produced an error.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.error? # true

error = job.error

returns.description: A status object with the status code and message, or nil if no error occurred.

methods.name: reload!
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job#reload!
methods.description: Reloads the job with current data from the long-running, asynchronous processing of an instance operation.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.done? #=> false
job.reload! # API call
job.done? #=> true

methods.name: wait_until_done!
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Instance
Job#wait_until_done!
methods.description: Reloads the job until the operation is complete. The delay between reloads will incrementally increase.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

job = bigtable.create_instance(
  "my-instance",
  "Instance for user data",
  type: :DEVELOPMENT,
  labels: { "env" => "dev"}
) do |clusters|
  clusters.add("test-cluster", "us-east1-b", nodes: 1)
end

job.done? #=> false
job.wait_until_done!
job.done? #=> true
